description.en: The course is intended for second year students majoring in Scandinavian languages and cultures. A knowledge of Danish at level B1 as described in the Common European Framework of Reference is a prerequisite for participating. The backbone of the course is language practice, including increasing vocabulary and discussing grammar problems. Active participation in the classes is expected. There is a lot of group and pair work. A great emphasis is also placed on individual work in Moodle and in preparation for class.
description.et: Kursus on mõeldud teise aasta tudengitele, kes õpivad Skandinaavia keelte ja kultuuride erialal. Kursusel osalemise eeltingimusteks on taani keele teadmised Euroopa Nõukogu keeleoskustasemel B1. Kursus on üles ehitatud praktilisele keelekasutusele sh. sõnavara laiendamisele ja grammatikaküsimustele. Tunnid eeldavad aktiivset osavõttu, teeme palju rühma- ja paaristööd. Samuti on suur rõhk iseseisval tööl Moodle'i keskkonnas.

objectives.en: The course intends to strengthen the students' practical knowledge of Danish, leading them to the language proficiency level B1.2 as described in the European Frame of Reference; develop the students' reading, speaking, listening and writing skills in Danish, deepen the theoretical base knowledge necessary for linguistic analysis and discussion, and expand knowledge of ways of expression characteristic to the Danish culture and society.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärgiks on süvendada tudengite praktilist taani keele oskust ja viia see Kursuse eesmärgiks on süvendada tudengite praktilist norra keele oskust ja viia see Euroopa Nõukogu keeleoskustasemele B1.2, arendada tudengite oskuseid taani keele lugemises, rääkimises, kuulamises ja kirjutamises, süvendada teoreetilised alusteadmised, mis on vajalikud lingvistilise arutelu ja analüüsi jaoks ning suurendada teadmisi taani keele ühiskonnale ja kultuurile omastest väljendusviisidest.

independent_work.et: The course combines writing, listening, speaking, and reading. In class, focus will be on speaking and listening, and for this reason, attendance is crucial to pass the course. If you miss more than six classes, you will be expected to do extra work, and the teacher may take points off your final mark. The students will have to prepare for each class in different ways: by taking small quizzes in Moodle, by writing longer texts at home (typically over the weekend), by giving presentations, and by actively participating in the exercises we do in class. The final exam consists of an oral exam as well as a written exam, which will count for 30% of the final grade.

grade_preconditions.et: Attendance (no more than 6 absences), passing all assignments and exams at a satisfactory level. All homework must be done in order to sit the final exam.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)
